source.source_title: SOLD: Coffee table, pecan, glass inlay
Pensive Adam at the canyon rim
This is overlooking the valley area, Barstow, Victorville off in the distance

text.text_content: Somewhere in the middle of the vast ocean there was a little squid named Eustace.
The little squid was rather awkward. He didn't have any brothers and sisters. The only other squids he knew were his parents, who were giant squids.
Honey, hurry up! We're gonna miss South Pacific Idol.
Well if somebody cleaned their ink up after themselves, then I'd have more free time.
You could land a submarine on his head!
I heard he escaped from squid row!
I bet he's from Sydney.
All of the other sea creatures found Eustace to be different, and said rude comments behind his back.
Life sure is safe in the ocean.
I can't wait to live a long, healthy life.
And you will Reginald, and this is coming from a guy who turns 115 tomorrow.
Until one day a fisherman snuck up behind the fish and snagged them all with his net.
Seeing his peers struggle as they flopped in the fisherman's net, Eustace knew what he must do.He squeezed, he molded, and he slid out of the net.

image.alt: The little squid escaping from the net

text_content.bold: I haven't even kissed my first invertebrate!
I'll never graduate from my school of fish!
Why am I always friends with younger fish?!

text.text_content: Being just a small creature, Eustace thought hard about how to save the other fish. He was too small to help out. And that's when it came to him, for Eustace knew how to save everyone.
He told his father.
Eustace helped save the fish! All the other fish wanted to be friends with Eustace. This made Eustace very happy, for he knew that one day he too will be able to destroy mankind.
Well now... what did you kids learn?
Have your parents fight for you! Make friends with squids!
Never trust a fish!

image.alt: A couple of items in the living room

text.text_content: Haha, I think the moral of the story is that your dad should thumb through the story before reading it to you.
It's time to get ready, we're going to see mom today.

image.alt: A couple of items in the living room

text.text_content: I can't wait to see mom!
She owes me a kiss!
By Mike Maether

image.alt: The car that the family is driving in

text.text_content: Mommy! I drew you a picture!
We missed you so much!

image.alt: A repeating animation of the EKG machine

text.text_content: I missed you two so very much! And James, what a wonderful drawing!

image.alt: Many drawings that was made for their mother

text.text_content: I'll ask the nurse for some tape, and I'll add it to your gallery.
Excuse me Mr. Stewart, may I have a word with you in the hall?
Is dad okay...?
When is mom coming home?
Is it tonight?
Well, Elizabeth, your mom has been sick for a long time now. Her condition is complicated, and I wish I could tell you when she’ll come back home, but I can’t.
Doctor Richardson found something, so mom will be having surgery tonight. I need to go back to the hospital.
Surgery...? Is mom... okay? Can we come?I want to be there for mom.
Yeah, I want to go too.
I'm sorry but you both have school tomorrow. Elizabeth, I need you to take care of James tonight.
No! I need to be there for mom. It's not fair that you're always leaving us at home. We love mom just as much as you!
Elizabeth, this isn't a negotiation, you're staying at home and you're taking care of your brother.
I need you, as the adult you're becoming, to take care of your brother. I know it's a lot to ask for, but I know you can handle it.
Hmph. Okay, I'll watch Jimmy.
I don’t need to be watched, I can tie my shoes by myself...
...they aren’t even Velcro.
Elizabeth, I know you're mad, but you're helping out the family more than you know. I love you two very much.
Liz, I can't sleep. I miss mom.

image.alt: Jimmy is laying in bed restless
A couple of items in the room

text.text_content: Well get used to it, she's never coming back.
Huh? What do you mean?

image.alt: A couple of items in the room

text.text_content: She's going to die in there. She's been in there for so long, and did you see all those machines? It'll just be us and dad soon.
No! That's not true! She'll get better and come home soon, that's what dad said.

text_content.bold: SHE'S DYING JIM! YOU'RE TOO YOUNG TO GET IT,
BUT ONCE SHE DIES SHE'LL BE GONE FOREVER!

image.alt: Jimmy is laying in bed upset

text.text_content: Jim running out.

image.alt: A couple of items in the room
Jim is running out of the house

text.text_content: I'm sorry, Jimmy. I'm sure mom will get better. I'm just mad.

image.alt: James is holding his knees, upset
Liz is sitting next to Jim
The top of the tree stump

text.text_content: What happens when people die?
Dad said that if you're good, you go to a better place.

image.alt: The middle of the tree stump

text.text_content: Mom would go to the best place in the world! A place with ice cream mountains and lollipop trees everywhere!

image.alt: Liz is sitting next to Jim

text.text_content: And there would be cotton candy clouds... and... and... chocolate rivers!

image.alt: The children day dreaming of the ice cream mountain
The middle of the tree stump

text.text_content: Hahahaha.
Hahahahahaha.

image.alt: Liz is sitting next to Jim
A cloud of smoke caused from the fallen star
A crater created by the falling star

text.text_content: Jimmy, wait! Don't touch that!

image.alt: Jim is running towards the crater
